author: Jack Davis
title: Bergdahl Seeks To Use Candidate Trump’s Words Against Him
text:
During his presidential campaign, Trump often referred to Bergdahl, calling him in one instance “a dirty, rotten traitor .” 
Now that Trump is America’s commander in chief, Bergdahl’s attorney said, those comments imperil justice. 
“There can be no doubt about what President Trump thinks of Sgt. Bergdahl,” Bergdahl’s lead attorney, Eugene Fidell, wrote in a court filing. “In a democratic society, it is a core premise that statements made by those who seek elective office must be taken seriously, especially when those statements are made repeatedly.” Advertisement - story continues below 
Major Justin Oshana, the military’s lead prosecutor, said the comments were part of Trump’s criticism of deals reached by Obama. 
“Any observer would be aware of Mr. Trump’s status at the time that he made the statements, and of the fact that he did not have any position within the government or the military,” Oshana wrote. 
Oshana said the jury selection process will determine whether Trump’s comments will impact potential jurors.
